This game is a toxic wasteland. Everyone thinks they're god's gift to dbd. When most the people who play this 
game are all on pretty equal skill levels. They constantly attack others for "lack of skill" when they do just as bad if not worse. When I play killer. Even after I kill everyone i'm constantly cursed at and called a "camping tunneler" I poured 100's of hours into the console version and it's the exact same way there. Nobody plays this game to have fun. They play it to ruin fun.

This game is a big pile of garbage. Instead of working on the graphics update, maybe they should work on some of the more present problems first. Why is it possible for a rank 16 killer to play against a rank 2 and 10 survivor? Why is this possible?? Why has there only been one gamemode for 4 fucking years?? Why are the hitboxes still broken as shit? Why is it so horribly balanced??? Fucking hell...

j'adore mdr grave bien avec des potes

I love this game, Ive spent a couple hundred hours on Xbox and have recently moved to PC.
Starting at rank 20 the killers are easy and survivors do just about nothing but getting to the blue and red ranks when you are matched with sweat survivors and killers running great builds the game gets intense, whether SWF or solo i get so engaged by the game, headset on, looping killers, finishing gens in the radius, opening exit gates with Michael Myers running at me with Judiths Tombstone addon and making it out alive, i just cant stop. Theres occasionally hitbox issues and some laggy games but overall this has been my favourite game for months, ive made some friends getting invited to a group call and spending the night chatting and playing with strangers and i can't wait for more DBD

Very good game. It's a very unique and fun take on the horror genre that scratches my RPG itch with its character customization. You can level up your characters, unlock perks for them, and equip them with tools to escape the killer. The cosmetics are also handled pretty fairly. You get currency for leveling up your account and gain more currency per level the higher you go, with a maximum of 300/level. You can then spend this currency in the shop to get cosmetics and characters. The game is entirely online and you can either be matched with randoms or survive with friends. The only reason I don't give it a perfect score is due to the fair amount of bugs the game has. They aren't always present, but when they are, they're weird as shit. The game is still being updated on what seems to be a quarterly basis and is getting a massive graphical upgrade soon, so the game still has a whole lot of longevity and potential. Overall, I'd give it a 8/10.
killers galore!!! and just endless fun all around
